title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 r. 202.70.4 - Electronic Submission of Papers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 r. 202.70.4 - Electronic Submission of Papers

State Regulations
(a) Papers and correspondence by fax. Papers and correspondence filed by fax should comply with the requirements of
section
202.5
(a) of this

Part except that papers shall not be submitted to the court by fax without
advance approval of the justice assigned. Correspondence sent by fax should not
be followed by hard copy unless requested. (b) Papers submitted in digital format. In cases not pending in the court's Filing by Electronic Means System, the
court may permit counsel to communicate with the court and each other by
e-mail. In the court's discretion, counsel may be requested to submit memoranda
of law by e-mail or on a computer disk along with an original and courtesy
copy. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
r. 202.70.4. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
